title: The OPL is looking for Referees/Observers
body:
EDIT - Hey, thanks for the applications. Submissions are now closed.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

Iâ€™m Riot Qualopec, Head Referee and Esports Coordinator here in OCE. The OPL is looking for new Referees and Observers for 2020!
 
As an OPL referee you will be the executioner of the match process. Youâ€™ll work within a referee team under the head referee, coordinating player movements, stage setup and acting as the authority on competitive matters. Weâ€™re looking for people with clear and strong communication skills as well as reliable and quick decision making skills.
 
As an OPL Observer you will be the eyes of the broadcast. You will work within the broadcast team and direct the in game camera showing the players at home what they need to see. Weâ€™re looking for people with high game knowledge, especially macro map movements (Diamond+ Jungle players) as well as an understanding of the competitive league of legends scene.
 
We are looking for people who will work in the Sydney studio on both Friday and Saturday of split 1 and split 2 (2 splits of 12 weeks).
 
If youâ€™re a dedicated League of Legends esports fan who has a strong knowledge of the game and think you fit on one of the above roles then prepare a resume and a cover letter and you can apply by filling in this form:[forms.gle/rpLHUHtK3iyCfNNy8](http://forms.gle/rpLHUHtK3iyCfNNy8)

EDIT: Because I've had a bunch of people ask. We will be closing submissions to this at around 10am on Friday 22nd November.

replies.body:
Hey ! Just wondering if applications have been finalised yet? 

I applied and hadn't heard anything so was just wondering whether that's a "didn't get in" or "we haven't finalised yet"!

Thank you so much <3

Hey!

No applications have not been finalised yet!

Sorry for the delays. we're still going through applications and will let everyone know the state of their application soon!

Edited - post not needed anymore. ðŸ˜…
 {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}  {{sticker:sg-soraka}}
I have already completed the form but I realised I forgot to put something in my resume when updating it. I did reference what I missed in the cover letter. What should I do?

Hey!

If you go back to the form link and sign in as the same account you submitted it with last time, it should give you the option to edit your response.

If not, simply submit another response and I'll discount the last one!

Hey there!

This sounds like a wonderful opportunity.

Just curious if thereâ€™s any in game screening for applicants such as honour checks etc?

Also what types of questions are you looking to be answered in the cover letter for either position?

Thanks

We do behaviour checks for all applicants applying for roles (these are a little more in depth than honor checks)

A standard cover letter is fine! Tell us about yourself!

This does seem very exciting!

Adding on to this behavior question, would players who have previously been banned 14 day or permanently be automatically disqualified? -Even if other factors in their application do not indicate a toxic individual.
Also are you open to accepting applications from knowledgeable players who don't specifically main the jungler role?

Thanks love the game and hope you find the right person.

Being banned is a serious flag, it would take an exceptional application and recent behaviour for us to move forward with an applicant like this.

Non Jungle roles are free to apply, the skill set we are most interested in bringing on board is that of a player who understands macro map movements and can identify when plays are being setup. We find Junglers are the best at spotting this, however any High Elo player should feel free to apply if they have the right knowledge.
I'd absolutely love the chance to do either, what kind of training is provided and also what kind of (if any) travel costs are covered.

Required training will be provided, I'm not sure how to explain the training itself besides that it will be enough to get you prepared for an OPL game day.

Travel is not provided. The role is best suited for someone based in Sydney and able to travel to our Studio in Pyrmont.
Who Should we address the cover letter too?
"Riot Games OCE" or "To who it may concern" or even me are all fine.
